uniol.apt.analysis.coverability

Class CoverabilityGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.analysis.coverability.CoverabilityGraph

  • public class CoverabilityGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a coverability graph of a Petri net. Let's first define the reachability graph: The reachable markings of a Petri net form a graph. The arcs between markings each belong to a transition which is fired for getting from one transition to another. This graph may be infinitely large. The coverability graph is based on the reachability graph. However, the markings used may contain OMEGAs which means that a place can have infinitely many tokens. This extension makes the coverability graph always bounded.
    Author:
    Uli Schlachter, vsp

    • Constructor Detail

      • CoverabilityGraph

        private CoverabilityGraph(PetriNet pn,
                          boolean reachabilityGraph)
        Construct the coverability graph for a given Petri net. This constructor is actually cheap. The coverability graph is constructed on-demand when needed. If you want to force full calculation of the graph, use the calculateNodes method.
        Parameters:
        pn - The Petri net whose coverability graph is wanted.
        reachabilityGraph - Should just reachability be checked and coverability be ignored?

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static CoverabilityGraph get(PetriNet pn)
        Construct the coverability graph for a given Petri net. If a coverability graph for this Petri net is already known, that instance is re-used instead of creating a new one.
        Parameters:
        pn - The Petri net whose coverability graph is wanted.
        Returns:
        A coverability graph.

      • getReachabilityGraph

        public static CoverabilityGraph getReachabilityGraph(PetriNet pn)
        Construct the reachability graph for a given Petri net. If a reachability graph for this Petri net is already known, that instance is re-used instead of creating a new one. Keep in mind that the reachability graph of a Petri net can be infinite!
        Parameters:
        pn - The Petri net whose coverability graph is wanted.
        Returns:
        A coverability graph.

      • get

        private static CoverabilityGraph get(PetriNet pn,
                                     boolean reachabilityGraph)
        Construct the coverability graph for a given Petri net. If a coverability graph for this Petri net is already known, that instance is re-used instead of creating a new one.
        Parameters:
        pn - The Petri net whose coverability graph is wanted.
        reachabilityGraph - Should just reachability be checked and coverability be ignored?
        Returns:
        A coverability graph.

        Calculate all nodes of the coverability graph.
        Returns:
        Number of nodes in the graph.

        private boolean visitNode()

      • getPostsetEdges

        java.util.Set<CoverabilityGraphEdge> getPostsetEdges(CoverabilityGraphNode node)
        Generate the postset of a given node. This may only be called by CoverabilityGraphNode.
        Parameters:
        node - Node whose postset should get generated.
        Returns:
        The node's postset

      • checkCover

        private Pair<CoverabilityGraphNode,Marking> checkCover(Marking cur,
                                                       CoverabilityGraphNode parent)
        Check if the given marking covers any markings on the current path. If the marking covers some other marking, suitable omegas are inserted.
        Parameters:
        cur - The marking to check.
        parent - The immediate parent node.
        Returns:
        null if no covering occurred, else the node that is covered and the covering marking.

      • getNode

        private CoverabilityGraphNode getNode(Transition transition,
                                      Marking cur,
                                      CoverabilityGraphNode from,
                                      CoverabilityGraphNode covered)
        Get a node from the coverability graph, creating it if it does not yet exist.
        Parameters:
        transition - The transition which reaches this new state.
        cur - The marking belonging to the state.
        from - The marking from which the transition reaches this marking.
        covered - node whose marking is covered by the given marking (or null if none)
        Returns:
        The node for the given marking.

        the inital node.

      • toReachabilityLTS

        public TransitionSystem toReachabilityLTS()
                                   throws UnboundedException
        Turn this coverability graph into a labeled transition system.
        Returns:
        The new transition system.
        Throws:
        UnboundedException - This exception is thrown when the Petri net is unbounded.
        See Also:
        For a version of this which does not reject unbounded nets.

      • toCoverabilityLTS

        public TransitionSystem toCoverabilityLTS()
        Turn this coverability graph into a labeled transition system.
        Returns:
        The new transition system.
        See Also:
        For a version of this which rejects unbounded nets.

      • toLTS

        private TransitionSystem toLTS(boolean onlyReachability)
                        throws UnboundedException
        Turn this coverability graph into a labeled transition system.
        Parameters:
        onlyReachability - Should only a reachability graph be generated?
        Returns:
        The new transition system.
        Throws:
        UnboundedException - Thrown if the reachability graph of an unbounded Petri net should be generated.
